intro: Pentameris scandens, commonly known as the climbing pentameris, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its twining stems that climb along other plants or structures. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically purple or pink in color. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. Pentameris scandens is often found in moist, shaded areas of woodlands and along stream banks.
